contentrichtext.text: {{One source|date=February 2012}} {{No footnotes|date=February 2012}} '''Guillaume Morel''' (1505 – 19 February 1564), [[France|French]] [[classical scholar]], was born at [[Le Teilleul]] in [[Normandy]]. After acting as proof-reader in a [[Paris]] firm, he set up for himself, and subsequently succeeded [[Adrianus Turnebus|Turnebus]] as king's [[printer (publisher)|printer]] in 1555. His most important work was ''Thesaurus vocum omnium latinarum'', containing a number of quotations from Latin authors, taken from hitherto unpublished manuscripts in the Paris library. He died in Paris. ==References== *{{1911}} {{Authority control|VIAF=51859339}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Morel, Guillaume | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1505 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 19 February 1564 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Morel, Guillaume}} [[Category:1505 births]] [[Category:1564 deaths]] [[Category:People from Manche]] [[Category:French classical scholars]] [[Category:French printers]]
